tweets.text:
Good to hear Suzanne Ward on @BBCRadioStoke talking about @EnvAgencyMids #airquality monitoring near Walleys Quarry.

Our 2 units will be in #odour report hotspots & meet monitoring best practice:
- Hamptons Housing Estate site is now liveüëá
- Silverdale Road site will start asap https://t.co/SGdkEn7Loh

@PHE_uk The situation with Walleys landfill Silverdale is becoming critical, you were warned last December & did nothing, high levels of hydrogen sulphide are still very present in our environment along with other LFG, not like the old data you sent me, it was more than cry wolf! https://t.co/78sMEGk3UB
https://t.co/mlHEnbzikd

It really is astonishing that the @EnvAgency @ClareDinnisEA has allowed it to get to the point where hydrogen sulphide levels are over WHO safety parameters.Hope u don‚Äôt start to suffer the tell tale harm to health @nikkehmiller -sore throats,headaches,nose bleeds #stopthestink https://t.co/XFGGyL8oAM

But the air quality must be ok because @PHE_EoEngland aren‚Äôt making a stand & saying it‚Äôs a problem?! 
You wouldn‚Äôt send a dog to live in the Newcastle under Lyme gas chambers @MattHancock @BorisJohnson @EnvAgency @StinkStopthe #stopthestink https://t.co/oRgYG5aFPR

@River_Douglas_ @EnvAgencyNW @RiverActionUK @Feargal_Sharkey @UnderwaterMedia Compliant with the General Binding Rules.....a septic tank discharging directly to a watercourse.....I think not!

Very easy solution to that problem @EnvAgencyNW

@StinkStopthe @EnvAgencyMids @ClareDinnisEA @Cap_it_off What a lovely morning to sit in the garden with a cup of coffee, unfortunately we can‚Äôt. The landfill smells terrible this morning, go for a walk not a chance. This is no way to live #StopTheStink

tweets.text: Short pick this morning, before invertebrate sampling with fellow @PickerelProject volunteers, Heather & Barry. Gipping is low & clear at the moment, but a good few Gammarus & olives recorded. @KeepBritainTidy @River_Care @AnglianWater @Riverflies @StowmarketTC @EnvAgency https://t.co/Ykru8i0iol
@chinbroom86 @YorkshireWater @EnvAgency @nedDC Wow this is awful! Can't believe they left it like this!
A nippy -4 at dawn this morning but worth it for the sunrise üòä https://t.co/o6ncadypYV

The team have attended reports of fish poaching @ExploreEssex Discovery Centre. Happy to report all persons fishing have complied with licence regulations with no evidence of fish being removed or killed. Please continue to report poaching & wildlife offences. @EnvAgency https://t.co/1kMxVfwL1d

tweets.text: Generally don't visit the GP to ask them to #StopTheStink @EnvAgency https://t.co/Vn1Pg5NIa1

Let's play a game. Let's see how long it takes @YorkshireWater or @EnvAgency to clean raw sewage from my wall and my neighbours house following a burst sewage pipe after it was reported. So far 5 days. Disgusting. @nedDC https://t.co/TjkF4jDtcy
@MrMarkwarren1 @StinkStopthe @PHE_uk @EnvAgencyMids @asthmauk When was this??
@njbrough88 @scottdegg @PHE_uk @EnvAgency Thank you, although it was @SarahInNUL that we owe credit for spotting this disparity.
